meanings.definition: Move or cause to move back and forth or from side to side while suspended or on an axis.
meanings.sent1: I love to swing on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The pendulum will swing from side to side.
meanings.sent3: The monkey decided to swing from tree to tree with glee.
meanings.sent4: Her mood can swing like a pendulum, unpredictable and changing.
meanings.sent5: The pirate ship swung wildly in the stormy sea.

meanings.definition: A seat suspended by ropes or chains, on which someone may sit and swing back and forth.
meanings.sent1: The children took turns on the swing at the park.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the feeling of freedom while on the swing.
meanings.sent3: The swing creaked softly as it moved gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The swing in the garden was like a peaceful rocking chair.
meanings.sent5: The old wooden swing swayed rhythmically under the tree.

meanings.definition: A style of jazz or dance music.
meanings.sent1: The band played a lively swing at the dance party.
meanings.sent2: She danced gracefully to the upbeat swing music.
meanings.sent3: The swing music made everyone tap their feet in joy.
meanings.sent4: The swing of the jazz band's music filled the room with energy.
meanings.sent5: The swing genre always gets people moving on the dance floor.
